3. Outdoor use, works great for garages, decks, outdoor patios, driveways or industrial spaces, workshops, lobby, mall and more, Also can be used any surfaces in your home including wood, tile, Concrete floors

4. Built to Last: Crafted from high-quality materials, designed for long-lasting use.5 layer bristles of this broom is stiff and strong, so it is good at collecting rubbish ,The width of the broom part is about 20 inch long, so it can sweep a large area at one time.
5. If you have any problems, you can contact us at once, we will give you a satisfactory solution.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a durable broom. It can handle all kinds of touch jobs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Wide Broom Medium Brush
reviews.reviewText: The angled broom is such a great idea the 60-degree angle is very helpful when I am using it. the wide bristles cover more space in less time and are very nice. My only disappointment is that the bristles are not hard as mentioned in the product description and it's soft-medium and not as dense as I expected. the steel rod is nice and putting it together takes less than a minute.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 3, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Sturdy broom hair not suitable for every cleaning
reviews.reviewText: There are few things I liked and disliked about this broom. Even though it was easy to assemble, it lacks some things that to me are important such as better hair material and softness and more sturdy handle material.The stiff bristles on the broom are what save it. They clean up trash, leaves, and other debris from a variety of outdoor areas well. The 20-inch width gives it good coverage, so it can be used in driveways, patios, and other big areas. The 51-inch handle isn't great or bad. On the one hand, it's useful for getting to faraway places without having to bend too far. That being said, the material feels a little weak. I've seen some bending happen when I sweep more vigorously, which makes me worry about how long it will last overall. Also, the broom hair is pretty stiff and isn't good for picking up small trash or cleaning inside.Unfortunately, the fact that the broom is so light is a big problem. Even though it makes it easy to move, it makes me wonder how long it will last. It doesn't feel as strong as I'd like for heavy-duty use outside, especially in industrial places or on surfaces like stone or wood.In conclusion, the Heavy Duty Outdoor Angle Broom is a good choice for basic cleaning jobs outside. It has stiff bristles and a handle that is pretty long to make it easier to use. But I can't give it a better grade because it's too light and I'm not sure how long it will last. Heavy-duty outdoor cleaning might require a more durable design.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a really nice item. The broom comes disassembled and shipped in a sturdy box. All the parts have a nice finish no rough edges and the broom assembles easily, no instructions necessary. Once the parts are tightened up the broom is very sturdy. The bristles are plastic and plenty enough to make a clean sweep. This is surely a 5 star buy and really a great value.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Very cheaply made.
reviews.reviewText: This broom is very cheaply made. The bristles are very wide and there are large gaps between the bristles so they aren't good for sweeping fine dust and dirt. It is more for sweeping sidewalks and driveways than garages. I find the angle the handle is on is comfortable. I think the current price of $22 is high for this broom.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. This broom is very lightweight, which has its benefits and drawbacks. It was super easy to assemble and the light weight makes it easy to transport. It does feel a bit flimsy due to the weight and quality of the bristles. The bristles look like they are plastic maybe. The handle has had a tendency to loosen up a bit. And starts to twist. It’s easy to just tighten it by twisting the handle again. This broom is obviously made for bigger areas. It didn’t work well on my steps as it was too large for the width of the stairs. I included a video of us sweeping up pine needles. It worked well for that. It is also easy to clean.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 19, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Keep it clean
reviews.reviewText: This is a nice broom to use around the shop where drill chips are. They usually hang up in other brooms, not this one. It is handy to clean along the edges of the floor where the building meets and has that rounded edge. Light but strong.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Great width, bristles not dense enough, cheap feeling
reviews.reviewText: I was looking for a broom to sweep my deck because the width on my house broom is too narrow. I really like the width of this broom, but that's about it. The metal handle pieces are very thin, cheapy aluminum, which okay. Easy to put together but make sure you really twist the pieces tight! Even if you do, what annoyed me was the pieces kept untwisting as I was sweeping. Also make sure you really put the handle piece very tight on the end. First time I started sweeping, the handle snapped off and I thought it broke! It didn't break, it just slipped off the end. I put it back on and went to work.I will say that it does sweep the pine needles, etc. off my deck, but I found that the bristles aren't as dense as my typical house broom so kept leaving a lot to have to re-sweep. I then went back to my home broom to test it out, and it really did a much better job. Again, I really do love the width and I think it would do an okay job. I don't think it would be worth paying the price (I'm a vine reviewer), and I would have returned it if I had purchased it. Maybe it does better on concrete and more dirt?It really does feel cheap, and I wonder how long it will last, especially with aggressive sweeping. Also because you have to keep going over the same spots. Another disclaimer though is that I was sweeping my deck after it rained. I will update review when I try on the dry deck. It may do much better with dry debris.
